definitions.definition: writing that is arranged in lines, often with a regular rhythm or pattern of rhyme

examples.text: Most of the play is written in verse, but some of it is in prose.

definitions.definition: a group of lines that form a unit in a poem or song
any one of the short numbered divisions of a chapter in the Bible

examples.text: She always read a few verses from the Bible before going to bed.

definitions.definition: the exact details of something, especially the exact place where particular information may be found

examples.text: I can't give chapter and verse, but that's the rough outline of our legal position.

wordOrigin: Old English fers, from Latin versus ‘a turn of the plough, a furrow, a line of writing’, from vertere ‘to turn’; reinforced in Middle English by Old French vers, from Latin versus.
